In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the implementation of `wrap_string` function in Julia programming language:

```julia
function wrap_string(words::Array, text_width::Int = 10)
    result = ""
    line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " " * word
    end

    result *= "\n" * line

    return result
end
```
This function accepts an array of words and a `text_width` parameter. It builds each line of the text until it exceeds `text_width`, then starts a new line. The resulting string contains the text with lines wrapped according to the specified width. 

Let's test this function:
```julia
words = ["Lorem", "ipsum", "dolor", "sit", "amet,", "consectetur", "adipiscing", "elit"]
print(wrap_string(words))
```
This will print the text with each line not exceeding 10 characters:
```julia
"Lorem ipsum\ndolor sit amet,\nconsectetur adipiscing elit"
```
